node.title: Cashing in: ASX fuels billions of dollars of wealth through floats in 2021
node.alt: .DO NOT PUB Rachel Pupazzoni image template
node.description: Why are so many companies listing on the ASX, who is benefiting and what exactly is involved in an initial public offeringÂ anyway?
node.content:
["More than $8 billion has changed\u00a0hands,\u00a0or\u00a0more accurately\u00a0bank accounts,\u00a0on the Australian Securities Exchange (ASX) each trading\u00a0day this year.", "An\u00a0unusually large number of private companies\u00a0have gone public, challenging long-held records for the\u00a0number of listings and money raised.", "While people who've never bought shares have invested\u00a0in Australian companies for the first time.", "\"This is a record year by number of listings since 2007, and it's also a record year in terms of capital raised since 2014,\" says\u00a0Max Cunningham, group executive of listings at the\u00a0ASX.", "About 200 companies will have gone public by the end of this year.", "It's the first year to rival the previous record, set at the height of the mining boom in 2007, when\u00a0251 companies launched on the ASX.", "\"But, perhaps most importantly, for us, it's an all-time record for a number of companies listing with market capitalisations over $1 billion,\" Mr Cunningham tells\u00a0The Business.", "", "
Group executive of listings at the\u00a0ASX, Max Cunningham, has been busy facilitating IPOs\u00a0this year.(ABC News: John Gunn)
", "CommSec senior economist Ryan Felsman says\u00a0it's no surprise companies are positioning themselves for future growth.", "\"They're looking to bolster their balance sheets,\" he explains.", "\"At the same time, they're looking to take advantage, opportunistically, of some other rivals that are potentially struggling at the moment, in particular\u00a0ones that have had impacts from government restrictions\u00a0which could weigh on revenue and earnings.\"", "
Why has there been so much activity on the ASX this year?
", "The simple answer is cheap\u00a0cash.\u00a0", "Investors and business owners alike want to make money, and government and central bank policies since COVID-19 have made share markets some\u00a0of the best places to do that.", "As investors pile their cash into the stock market, instead of bank accounts that aren't delivering much return, companies are benefiting.", "Previously, privately owned companies have jumped on the public-listing bandwagon in a bid to benefit from all that extra cash in the market.", "\"It's\u00a0a global phenomenon \u2014\u00a0it's not just linked to Australia,\" Mr Cunningham explains.", "\"The capital market\u00a0and hopefully shareholders\u00a0are beneficiaries of that.\"", "Research by finance firm EY shows about 1,600 companies globally have floated this year.", "\"That is certainly the strongest we have seen globally since 2017,\" Mr Felsman says.", "\"As vaccination rates increase\u00a0and the global economy continues to reopen, we're expecting to see economic activity build, and companies are looking for organic growth or looking to certainly focus on the growth options going into that strength.\"", "
What is 'going public'?
", "When a company \"goes public\"\u00a0(you might also hear this described as\u00a0when a company \"lists\" or \"floats\")\u00a0anyone can buy a piece (or share) of that company.", "The first time a company does this is during its initial public offering (IPO).", "From then on, investors can buy and sell shares in that company for as long as it remains a public company.", "With so many investors keen to spend their money trading shares,\u00a0there hasn't been a better time for a business that's been thinking of going public\u00a0to list for the first time.", "", "
Christian Price says Nimy Resources will use the money raised in its IPO to carry out more assessments of its nickel resource in Western Australia.(ABC News: Rachel Pupazzoni)
", "Nickel explorer\u00a0Nimy Resources has raised $6\u00a0million ahead of its IPO today,\u00a0Nimy Resources managing director\u00a0Christian Price tells\u00a0The Business.", "Nimy\u00a0believes it's discovered a new nickel deposit in Western Australia.", "It needs more money to keep exploring and assessing what it finds.", "\"We've got a lot of areas that are undercover\u00a0so we're using\u00a0geophysics and drilling to find\u00a0the higher concentrations and higher grades of nickel sulphides, to then look at defining an economic nickel sulphide resource,\" Mr Price says.", "", "
Workers operate a drilling rig at a Nimy Resources prospecting site.\u00a0(Supplied: Nimy Resources)
", "Demand for nickel, a key\u00a0component in batteries, is growing as the world electrifies and Nimy wants to enter that lucrative market.", "It listed at an opening price of 20 cents a share.", "", "
Nimy Resources' nickel project in Western Australia.(Supplied)
", "In 2007, Australia's IPO boom\u00a0was led by mining and\u00a0the same sector is driving the rush again this year.", "\"We're seeing the biggest recovery in the mining sector\u00a0in over a decade,\" Mr Cunningham says.", "He says\u00a0the\u00a0rest of the growth\u00a0has been across the board\u00a0but weighted toward tech and health-related companies.", "
How does a company go public?
", "\"Going through the IPO process\u00a0has been an interesting exercise,\" Mr Price says.", "\"You need to find your independent experts in terms of geology, people who've got specific knowledge of nickel sulphides, which in WA has been increasingly rare to find.", "\"Then you need to start building your team with your lead manager,\u00a0 your legal team and also with your board and management to get all that mix right.", "\"It's not that easy.\"", "Going public requires a large range\u00a0of checks and balances by the Australian Securities and Investments Commission (ASIC) and the ASX.", "Having the right people working on\u00a0the process can help streamline that.\u00a0", "", "
Managing director Karim Najaim says taking ActivePort public was a much\u00a0longer and more in-depth process than the company expected.(ABC News: John Gunn)
", "ActivePort, a telecommunications company that produces software to connect people around the world, worked on its IPO for 12 months before the big day in October.", "\"It was longer than I expected, but it's long for a reason,\" ActivePort managing director Karim Nejaim tells\u00a0The Business.", "\"There are a lot of shareholders investing their money or their clients' money.", "Foremost among all the\u00a0paperwork required is the company's prospectus.", "", "
The all-important prospectus is lodged with ASIC before a company can start attracting investors.(ABC News: Rachel Pupazzoni)
", "The prospectus outlines everything there is to know about the business:\u00a0what it is or does, how it's managed, its balance books, plans for the future, and what it will do with the money it's raising from\u00a0the IPO.", "With each share\u00a0valued at 20 cents, ActivePort raised $12 million in its IPO. It plans to use that money to grow its business globally.", "\"The share price hung around the listing price for a short period and has now dropped away slightly, so\u00a0what we're finding is the market is now saying, 'OK, we understand what you're doing, we understand the way you're going to do it.\u00a0Show us the numbers.'\"", "It's not unusual for share prices to fall following\u00a0an IPO, after the\u00a0hype and fear of\u00a0missing out die\u00a0down.", "\"Now the real work starts.\u00a0Let's hit the promises and let's give the market confidence where we're\u00a0taking this,\" Mr Nejaim says.", "
What's in it for shareholders
", "", "
Australian shareholders benefit from some of the highest dividends in the world.(ABC News: John Gunn)
", "Everyone in\u00a0this scenario wants to make money.", "Sometimes investors have to wait for that return.", "As time goes on and a company begins to deliver on its milestones, more investors might want to buy in.", "With more demand, and as the company delivers results, the share price is pushed higher.", "So\u00a0that initial investment at 20 cents a share might later be worth 40 cents, $4\u00a0or $40 a share.\u00a0There is no limit to what market pressure can do to a share price.", "Investors make money by selling their shares for more than they paid for them.", "Although it can often work the other way, with shares falling in value from their IPO level and not recovering.", "", "
IPOs can be a glamorous affair. Supermodel Jennifer Hawkins rang the bell\u00a0to herald Myer's listing on the ASX in 2009.(Julian Smith: AAP)
", "Myer is a well-known example.\u00a0It floated in 2009 at $4.10 a share, but has never traded above that and is now worth about 50 cents a share.", "But the other way to make money on shares is with dividend payments.", "If a company is doing well, it passes on some of that windfall to shareholders.", "That's certainly been the case this year.", "Analysis by global asset manager\u00a0Janus Henderson\u00a0shows Australian dividends have grown four times faster than the rest of the world.", "It says third-quarter payouts in Australia rose by 126 per cent to a record $41.9\u00a0billion.", "Globally, dividend payments increased less than a 10th of that, rising 11.3 per cent.", "Most of that growth came from the mining sector, which \u200b\u200b\u200b\u200b\u200b\u200bdelivered $25.4\u00a0billion in dividends in quarter three, thanks to record commodity prices.", "The\u00a0world's biggest miner, BHP, is set to become the world's biggest dividend payer in 2021, with the combined payouts of its UK and Australian divisions hitting $25.6 billion.", "
Will this amount of ASX activity continue?
", "", "
High commodity prices have delivered windfalls for some miners, who've been passing them\u00a0on to shareholders.(ABC News: John Gunn)
", "The momentum on the ASX doesn't appear to be abating as we head into 2022.", "\"We're very optimistic in the short term,\" Mr Cunningham says.", "\"We see nothing that slows the market down.", "Payment platform company Square bought Afterpay, offering\u00a0$126.21 per Afterpay share.", "It was a\u00a0significant increase on its 2016 IPO price\u00a0of $1 a share.", "Square's entry into the ASX via its acquisition of Afterpay is likely to happen in early January.", "It's not strictly an IPO but it will set 2022 off to a solid start in terms of capital on the ASX.", "\"I think there's a lot of room for optimism at the moment,\" Mr Cunningham concludes.", "Mr Felsman isn't as confident.", "", "
CBA senior economist Ryan Felsman\u00a0says companies are taking\u00a0advantage of the extra cash moving through the economy.(ABC News: Dan Irvine)
", "But he expects there will continue to be growth in\u00a0stock markets due to e-commerce businesses", "\"There are conditions or situations perhaps whereby these companies may look to go from privately owned to publicly listed companies,\" he says."]
